alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 12:53PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Montezuma County through 130 PM MDT... At 1253 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northwest of Shiprock, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Montezuma County, including the following locations... Towaoc. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 6. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 10 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
